title: So so
description: Service is not bad  place also good  but the food just so so only. 菜色清淡，吃不出有什么特别之处，普通的请客吃饭因为地点的关系还可以

title: Consistently good
description: I have always enjoyed my meal here. The ingredients are of good quality and the dishes are deliciously tasty and most importantly consistent. Highly recommended.

title: Dinner 3 paxs
description: After a while since I last came here must I say its still one of the better restaurants around for authentic chinese food. Definitely keeps up its reputation and standard. Had the xo sauce mee tai mak  prawn noodles (special promotion) dan dan noodles fried

title: nice food
description: the food is good especially the okinawa ribs . like the sauce very much. but the seating there is too narrow.

title: Thumbs up!
description: Celebrated Father's Day at Xi Yan. Food was yummy  service for great and the price was reasonable! Definitely coming back for other family gatherings

title: Excellent food
description: We went to this restaurant by accident. Usually  we will either choose a restaurant which we had frequent or places that were recommended by others. It is quite seldom that I can bump into such a good restaurant and yet we walk out saying that

title: A different kind of Chinese food
description: I found the food quite different from what I would get in other Chinese restaurants in Singapore. They offered different portions and we ordered many dishes with the smallest serving. Every dish that we tried was very good. The food was a bit oily. The

title: Dinner after Cinema
description: Tugged away on the third floor of Shaw Center  one can mistakingly walk by this restaurant. A small restaurant but the food is somewhat unique Chinese restaurant. We began with jelly fish and cucumber in sesame wasabi sauce (served cold)  steamed cod fish with white

title: Family dinner
description: First time there and the place is small so recommended to call first and make bookings. Food was delicious and we wanted to try all dishes but with four of us is impossible so we are coming back again. The menu is a mixture of

title: No Xi’an fish maw at Xi Yan Shaw
description: Not only the food is innovative with interesting  modern interpretations of traditional Chinese cuisine  but the dishes are also scrumptuous. It’s a bit hidden  so it attracts a mainly local clientèle. Don’t miss the signature dishes  like salivating chicken  deep fried pork belly  rice in

title: Reasonable price with good food
description: Reasonable price with good food. The restaurant is pretty small and thus the service from the servers are good and they are attentive.

title: Excellent food  value for money
description: Enjoyed almost every dish ordered! The vegetables with eggs three way was really delicious too. standard portions were good for four to five ppl to share.

title: SHC
description: Xi Yan Shaw is having a different approach and image as compared to Xi Yan Private Dining in Craig Road. Xi Yan Shaw is focusing on casual dining for family and small gatherings with lower pricing and wide variety for the diners. Out of the

title: Great service great food
description: Prompt And courteous service. Food was good. Serving size is good for small groups. Good place to gather friends.

title: Yummy food
description: I am back to Xi Yan Shaw again as the food is tastefully creative with new dishes and affordable. Service is not bad.

title: Average HK style food
description: It was our first time to Xi Yan restaurant in Singapore though we have been to a few of their outlets in HK. The one in Singapore has been localised I reckon to suit the local tastebuds. However the service was good but food was

title: Superb dishes
description: Ordered the dan dan noodles and the Yong Dao fu soup. It was superb. I didn't have the msg effect though the dishes are tasty. My first visit as recommended by my frd at this branch and will visit again.

title: Ready to Close Down
description: Had lunch on 27 Dec  restaurant was 50% full upon our visit  only 2 waitress on duty. Stood at entrance for 5 minutes  in the end walked in and asked for 2 seats. All customers had to look for waitress in order to place order.

title: Good but tad noisy
description: Nice food though portions rather small for the price. Service adequate but rather noisy given the open setting and low ceiling.

title: Family dinner
description: We had the daily soup  steamed cod on rice noodles etc and tang yuen for desserts. Restaurant was full and noisy!

title: a regular at XI Yan  tasty food at affordable prices
description: not my first time at XI YAN SHAW  tried their fried rice this round  its extremely tasty and portion was gd enough for 3 pax. their coconut ice cream dessert with pudding was quite gd as well.

title: Cool
description: Great foods all tge fiids are very nice... Clean place soft music..... Nice stuffs cool.. We'll come again.

title: Good
description: the food was good  except for the salted egg squid was quite disappointing. the price is reasonable. this is singapore  short-handed is common.

title: Good quality food
description: Visited Xi Yan Shaw again after some time. The food quality is still good. We loved the steamed cod fish fillet with rice noddles. Soup of the day is also value for money. Service was fast and the staff is attentive.

title: Simple traditional dishes
description: Food was served quite fast considering the night crowd. Food was presented well. We like the fried beehoon w pork leg very much.

title: Value-for-money
description: Was trying to find an affordable place for lunch with the kids but not more of the same-old. Decided to go back to Xiyan. The restaurant delighted us with its Hakka food. Tasty. Kids loved it.

title: The whole place is too cold for comfort
description: Service and food are both good but the whole place is simply too cold for comfort. The food turned cold after 3 mins upon arrival!

title: Xi you soon
description: @TheKuoKnows Hakka cuisine is still a bit of a rarity in Singapore. It shouldn’t be. But it is. Xi Yan Shaw on Scotts Road is a real credit to Hakka style cooking. It is the simplicity that makes it so delicious. Hats off to the

title: Unique and a place that you will visit again
description: Great Chinese fusion food in Shaw Center. The Pregnant Woman Fried Rice is highly recommended. The combination of olive  dried radish and dry shrimps are perfect. Simply mind blowing due to the uniqueness. The eggplant and pork patties are good choices too.

title: Chinese Cuisine
description: The food presentation is OK. The general taste especially the Water Chestnut and Pomelo Salad is above average. Customer service is good.

title: Experience in Xi Yan Shaw
description: It is a place that I will recommend - Be it with friends or family  small or big group. The dishes are unique and some are 'traditional' that remind me of home cooked food by our grannies. Don't miss out the desserts - I love

title: Excellent food
description: We enjoyed the seafood beehoon and the rest of the food. Ambience was nice yet casual which was a perfect setting for meet ups with friends.

title: Great food - always a winner with my friends
description: Authentic and uncommon Hokkien and Cantonese dishes with a flair - don't miss the pig trotters fried bee hoon and yong tau foo.

title: Reasonable price
description: Dishes were reasonably priced and food were tasty. However  seemed to be slow in service although it is a small restaurant.

title: Heartwarming and delicious food
description: The food was very delicious  and the flavours were mostly on point. We loved almost all the dishes we ordered  and the desserts were good as well. We will definitely head back there for another meal in future.

title: Reliable chinese food
description: Xiyan used to have dishes that are delightful surprises  but these days  it's just a nice reliable place for comfort food.The service has dipped as well  from warm and competent staff to those who don't really know their stuff and instead of finding out  try

title: Not as good as our first visit.
description: This was our second visit and we left feeling disappointed. At 7 p.m. had already run out of their daily special  the Ginger Chicken as well as their roast chicken. The pork trotter with bee hoon was also not available. The deep fried pork belly

title: Good food
description: We shared a number of dishes and were happy with them all. Most memorable was the cheese wings. Staff were friendly and efficient.

title: Another great experience
description: We came back with friends and everyone packed a dish back to share with their family cuz it's SOOO good.

title: sweet dinner
description: went for dinner at Xi Yan shaw. saw pictures of the dishes and decided to try out. We ordered a few recommended dishes to share. we did not like any of the dishes at all. perhaps people who enjoy sweet chinese dishes might like them???

title: simple and tasty food
description: The food is simply prepared but full of flavor. We had the salted duck  pork ribs  qing long veggies  mall tofu w preserved olives and pregnant woman fried rice. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs! The food is full of strong flavors that are

title: Great food
description: Came here with my godma and we both thoroughly enjoyed the food. Every dish we ordered was good. Unfortunately we sat nxt to a very loud inconsiderate table debating a fmly issue which dampened our otherwise outstanding experience.

title: Xi Yan Shaw
description: Very impressive!!! Must try the fried xo sauce cai po raddish cake & hakka marinated duck with sweet sauce!

title: Good food but moderate service
description: Overall food was good with valued lunch set meal. However the services there wasn't pleasant due to some error of order taking but the food was being replaced immediately. Followed by the service request  we requested to serve our dessert after main course  but they

title: Awesome experience
description: Their crispy rice in fish broth is excellent. I can never have enough of it. Friendly staff also made the visit an enjoyable one.

title: Thumbs Up for Xi Yan!
description: I enjoyed the food served in Xi Yan. I've brought 2 groups of friends there and their comments are the food is special and delicious. The staff are friendly and make good recommendations so we do not over order and waste food. Overall dining experience

title: Not bad!
description: the food was really good with different ethnic tastes  service was equally good! However the place is a bit small so it felt a bit congested.

title: Good wholesome food
description: Good food  ambience and service. Tried the bean curd with chai po and was surprised that the tofu was not at all salty. The crunchiness of the chai po goes very well with the tofu. Will be back again.

title: Interesting innovative Chinese fare
description: Dishes were very reasonably priced  considering how delicious and creative they are. A must try is the porridge!

title: Find uncommon cantonese and hakka dishes here - yummy!
description: Great prices and generous portions of interesting  uncommon but super shiok dishes. Much better concept than the original Xi Yan at Craig Road. So far  everyone I've brought here loved the food and swore they'd be back with their families.

title: Great value for lunch set!
description: Food quality is good. Set lunch price is reasonable. Must try their truffle fried egg with shrimps. However  seems lack of manpower.

title: Nothing fantastic
description: food was ok but the restaurant was very open concept.. service was good and prices are also friendly..

title: excellent chinese food
description: kudos to the staff on duty  extremely friendly and great recommendations on food. have been supporting xiyan for many years. food are consistently gd

title: Not your usual Chinese dishes!
description: Had dinner here a few times and will go back again as the dishes are far from boring...Service is prompt & friendly too👍👍👍 Everytime-sure-to-order dishes are the XO Radish Cake  Cod fish rice noodle and the Hakka Lo Shi Fan.👍👍👍 For drinks the Kamquat Honey

title: Decent priced Chinese cuisine in orchard
description: Service staff were very attentive and efficient. The service stood out more for me than the food  the XO mee tai mak was tasty but a tad too dry. Loved their mapo fried tofu  the butter salted egg yolk squid we found the rings too

title: Great food and fast service
description: Second time dining there and the quality of the food is consistently good. I love the fish soup with rice. Great ice cream too. I enjoyed both the lychee ice cream with osmanthus flowers sprinkled on top as well as the gula melaka ice cream

title: Great chinese restaurant in the city
description: Affordable and great tasting food served by Xi Yan Shaw in Orchard! Great serice provided in this restaurant too

title: Just an average Lunch
description: I revisited the placed after 1 year ago. I ordered bitter gourd  fish with pomelo sauce  fried vermicelli  fried rice and pork rib with vinegar. The bitter gourd tasted half cook; fish coated with thick flour & the sauce was sweet & sour rather than

title: Great gathering
description: Great promo for month of July  free portion of Xi Yan's signature niang tou foo for min 2 diners and $30 spent.

title: Comfy Dinner @ Xi Yan
description: It's always a joy to dine at Xi Yan - be it lunch or dinner. Service is good  servers are attentive and easy-going and friendly. Many dishes on menu are akin to home-cooked food. Best part is prices are not damaging to your wallet. My

title: value for money
description: Good place for value for money and homecooked food. Worth a visit. They also catered to 1 portion order so if you are alone  you can still dine there

title: Both service & food are good
description: All the staffs are friendly & handle queries very well. Been there a few times & the food never fail me. But would like to call out that for the Hong Kong steam fish  the taste is good but the fish texture is a bit

title: Dinner
description: The restaurant was relatively quite for Monday night with about a couple tables occupied. Service was fast. Pork Patty with Salted Fish and Water Chestnut ($6++/ petite) The patties looked simple and a tab dry but it was savoury and crunchy inside. Salivating Spicy Chicken

title: Food is good & creative
description: I have been to Xi Yan at Duxton but this one at Shaw Center is pretty good too. The food comes with some surprises in terms of taste - creativity.

title: Average
description: Food tastes fine  nothing special. We remember taste was better a few years ago when this outlet just started. Service is passable. Overall  just average.

title: Homey cooking with friendly service
description: The style of cooking at this restaurant is rather homey. Some of the dishes are quite local. The service is friendly.

title: Excellent service
description: impeccable service staffs. food was good if only if it was less salty. every dish we ordered was a tad too salty.

title: Food was better a couple of years back
description: We went there a couple of years back and the food was very good. Decided to go back there for lunch as we were there to watch a movie. We ordered the truffle fried rice (no truffle taste at all  it was very blend)  the

title: Delightful Cuisine
description: Chefs do a wonderful job of ensuring the right balance of taste and texture. I have never been disappointed in my visits. Do make reservations especially for weekends.

title: Casual dining...
description: We were quite taken aback considering the fave reviews. Except for the service it was very 'foodcourt' dining of local fare...

title: Good Food! Good service!
description: Morden Chinese resturant centrally located. We enjoyed the yummy food and the food portion is just right. Will defintely go back again.

title: Great food  service and ambience
description: The choice of food was amazing and all dishes we ordered were exquisite. Especially loved the Yong Dao Fu  Fried Radish Cake  Dou Miao. Service was impeccable  and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. A nice affordable and casual restaurant with great food. I only wish

title: Environment & Taste
description: Tucked away in Shaw  a nice and quiet place to dine. Personal favourite : rice in superior fish soup Prefer the fried lo shi fan with Xi Yan XO sauce over the hakka style  though both was equally peppery. The Kailan with Crispy olive leaves

title: Classmates birthday
description: We had a wonderful meal at Xi Yan Shaw. The menu selection and food portion is good. Will definitely go back again.

title: Superb Service
description: First time patronise 喜宴 @ Shaw. Service standard remain fine dinning standard. Dishes are awesome and so yummy.

title: Homely yummy hakka food
description: Decided to check out this place after scouting around for lunch. We ordered Yong tau foo noodles  butter gourd with minced meat and olive leaves  fried tofu with spicy meat sauce  vinegar pig trotters and fried carrot cake. Everything turned out delicious except for the

title: Innovative Chinese dishes
description: Liked the food here and service was prompt. They had interesting and innovative dishes not typically found at the usual found at the typical Chinese restaurants. Dishes I liked: black truffle prawns omelette  salted yolk pork ribs  steamed cod  & deep fried pork belly in

title: Great food and service
description: I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner at Xi Yan Shaw. I have been there a couple of times but never once was I disappointed with their food and service. My favourite dishes are carrot cake and their fried rice.

title: Nice place
description: Good food and good service Nice ambience and centralised location.interesting signature dishes and highly recommended

title: Good food
description: Made prior reservation and brought 2 friends to try this restaurant. Its not my first time  perhaps my third. The good thing is that the restaurant and menu is small so you can decide your order pretty quick and the get your food quick too.

title: Excellent Prosperity dinner with great customer service
description: Searched prior to leaving Perth  found Xi Yan Shaw Casual had a Prosperity Dinner set menu for two persons  with an online booking option. Came here for the prosperity dinner Sunday evening  6th Feb  with my local friend - we enjoyed menu set C -

title: Contemporary Chinese food with an artful touch
description: A no-frills modern Chinese restaurant that gives a contemporary update to otherwise traditional dishes. Do not expect private dining areas in this small establishment but it has a nice ambience with cheerful artworks adorning its walls. Food is reasonably priced and service staff are very

title: CNY set Menu for 2
description: Love the YuSheng which was surprisingly good with salad leaves and plum sauce. The prawns came with pineapples and apple slices goes v well. Did not like the marinated pork belly. The pepper chicken pieces came mostly in breast meat. I expected it to be

title: Hakka Canto fusion food
description: Must tries are the salted egg yolk prawns and the truffle omelette and the ruffle fried rice. Other dishes are really yummy and we love that the food is always service hot and promptly.

title: Very happy customer
description: It was my first visit to Xi Yan and I wonder why I didn't discover this restaurant earlier! The Yu Sheng was not your typical ingredients but tasted good. Dishes are also not commonly found outside but we enjoyed all of them. Restaurant also served

title: Dinner at Xi Yan restaurant
description: The food was delicious  unique and service rendered was reasonable. The chef is able to tweak some of the traditional dishes with new and innovative flavours to tickle the palate. The only setback was the place was a tad too cramped.

title: Great flavours  reasonable prices
description: Xi Yan never fails for a casual family dinner  reasonably priced and delicious Chinese food. Particularly love the chestnut pork leg beehoon they have as a monthly special  pls keep it on the menu!

title: Average
description: Location good  However cant fit in big group  max can only 8pack. Rerservation is fast and fast using Chope!More

title: Value for money set lunch
description: Try the set lunch. The servings for the rice/noodles mains were big. If you are a small eater then share the set and order some meats from the a la carte menu. We tried the salivating chicken appetiser which was an interesting blend of flavours

title: Amazing weekday set lunches
description: Lucky to have lunch with 4 good colleges and friends. Shared the prawn  3egg vegetable soup  pork  and gourmet ice cream deserts. For sub $17 plus plus sets the quality was amazing. Will definitely be back. The only Con is that the restaurant was too

title: As good as their hkg outlet
description: So glad to have xi yan in Sg. I love their branch in taikooshing hkg and have tried their outlet in Craig Rd but this branch in Shaw mirrors very closely to the one in hkg. Can't wait to come back here again.

title: Great place with tasty food - Really tasty.
description: I have chanced upon this restaurant through a Friend and am so Glad that it was recommended. Loved the oriental vibe to the place with their decorations and setting. Even though it was dinner time  it wasn't noisy but just comfortable. Service was prompt and

title: I will be going back!
description: Discovered this by accident and turned out to be a great new addition (to my own list) of favorite Chinese restaurants in Singapore. The lunch sets are quite reasonably priced though I can imagine the a la carte menu could be expensive. Good food and

title: Good food and service
description: Went for early Sunday lunch at Xi Yang  Shaw. Comfortable  relaxing small eatery with good food and service.

title: Enjoyed my lunch
description: They serve simple but yet tasty dishes. Quite surprised to find Hakka abacus beads in the special menu on my visit. It was very delicious. I loved the dan-dan noodle. It was different from the usual Sichuan style. This has a nutty and sesame taste

title: Great experience!
description: Had dinner with a gf  the service staffs were pleasant and attentive. Food quality was good  but I find the price is a bit expensive.

title: Unique Dishes
description: Tucked in a quiet corner of a quiet mall  it is hard to get foot traffic. Thus Xi Yan has to rely on regulars that are drawn there solely by the taste of the food. Instead of the usual fare that you'll find in a

title: Delicious Tasty Food
description: We came here for lunch on sunday  we have ordered golden tofu with fried olive leaves in mapo sauce  xo carrot cake  di huang miao and black truffle yunnan ham fried rice. All the dishes were delicious and tasty. We wanted to ordered desserts but

title: Your average place for daily dining
description: I came here because I've heard good reviews of this restaurant. Everything on the menu sounded delicious so we decided to order the recommended /signature dishes. To be honest  the soy duck was a total let down. The slices were cut a bit too thick

title: Tasty dishes
description: Dishes are delicious and well presented. The tofu dishes were yummy and the sauces were not too salty. Special mention must be made for the cod fish with rice noodle which was my favorite. Worth a try!

title: Splendid Easter Dinner
description: This is the place where I bring my girlfriend to for dinner when she's unhappy  to cheer her up. It works everytime mainly cuz of the 2 amazing dishes stated above and I'll repeat it here again for the fun of it: A) Prawn Paste

title: Easter Day Lunch
description: Lovely smoked egg with truffle & salmon roe to celebrate Easter. The dish i love most is their porridge which is extremely tasty & it warms my heart  calms my day. You definitely have to try it yourself! Recently they included vinegar pig trotters in

title: Excellent service  excellent food!
description: Had a delightful dinner at this exceptional restaurant a few times. Tucked away in Shaw Centre  it is not exactly easy to find this little gem. Nevertheless the food is really great  just look at the menu! Love the ribs  the toufu and noodles. The

title: One of my favorite places to eat in downtown
description: Quality and innovative cuisine at an affordable price. Recommended for those who are a bit tired of the local dining scene  and would like to try a different take on local favorites without breaking the bank. Unlike the flagship private dining venue in Tanjong Pagar

title: CNY lunch
description: Very impressed with the taste and presentation of the foods we ordered. We truly enjoyed our lunch. The yusheng is unique and appetising  very different from other restaurant.

title: Good food but the service staff spoil the entire experience!
description: Let me start by saying that I love Xi Yan private dining so I was quite pleased to hear that it started the Shaw Center unit that does not require reservation ahead and cater to small group. I was extremely disappointed. Firstly  the good :

title: chinese food with a slight twist at orchard rd
description: Location- At shaw centre on the 3rd level. Nearest train station is Orchard. Food - I must state that I didn't really read the menu carefully. We ordered 1 rice superior fish soup and 1 niang doufu noodles. The niang doufu noodles is quite okay.

title: Beyond Casual Dining
description: Xi Yan is located in Shaw Center on 3rd floor. The location is not so ideal near the corner. But a lot of people are eating at restaurant. The food is really delicious. We ordered bitter gourd with minced pork  bean sprout and marinated duck.

title: Centrally located Chinese Fast Food
description: A spin-off from their banquet style resturant  this outlet offers the same high quality tasty Chinese dishes but with mid-range prices  no-frills everyday dishes  fast service and down-to-earth ambience. Located on the third floor of Shaw Centre in the heart of Orchard Road shopping district.

title: Healthy Choice for Chinese  Tofu Based Menus  very popular and tasty Chinese
description: There are no questions that there are many Chinese restaurants in Singapore. Xi Yan offers more healthy choices and also very good value for money. I liked their Tofu related theme as well as their noodle choices. Stafffs are friendly and it is very popular.

title: A different kind of Chinese cuisine
description: Innovative cooking  or classical dishes with a twist - the food is surprisingly good and creative for such a small restaurant. Now that they have settled in  service is also much better - friendly and knowledgeable. Good value too.

title: Gem of a place
description: Known originally as a private dining place  XI Yan's little restuarant tucked into the corner of level 3 of Shaw Centre in Singapore  is a little gem of a place. Casual  but neat and appealing  the restaurant offers innovative dishes  like its private dining menu.

title: Fast service
description: My husband and I visited on Father's Day and it was very crowded. The restaurant manager politely informed us that they could not take in any more guests on that day so we decided to visit again the following week. It was on Sunday at

title: Lights switched off 25 mins before restaurant's official closing time
description: Bizzaire experience of having the staff gather at a table  all heads turned to our direction with frowns on their faces. A few minutes later  one of them decided to switch off the lights to drive the message home. Funny  it was 9.35pm and the

title: Overrated
description: I was lured here by a glowing review in a local newspaper. Eager to share a good find  I dragged my colleague along. When we arrived for lunch on a weekday  there was a good crowd. Looks good. I ordered Rice in Superior Fish Soup

title: Nothing special
description: We went there on a weekday evening and there was no queue. Since there were only two of us  we were assigned a small table. It was so small that later it couldn't fit all the dishes (three dishes  two glasses of drinks and later

title: Comforting Food
description: 10 years after Xi Yan opened their private dining restaurant on Craig Road  the latest addition featuring fast and comfort food carries on the same tradition - delicious  fuss-free food which is tasty without relying on expensive ingredients like sharks-fin and abalone which are synonymous

title: Decent  easy on the pocket
description: I was there shortly after it opened. Casual dining  no fuss. I tried the Basil Prawn Noodles in Spicy Wine Broth. It was delicious  but a bit too salty for my taste. It would have been better if they held back on the salt. Even

title: Slow Service Spoilt Experience
description: The restaurant has a casual dining concept  different from its sister outlet Xi Yan Private Dining. Place is very small and tables are placed very close to each other. Not much privacy to speak about. Expect to queue for a table. Service is extremely slow.
